a1: CRC32 (Cyclic Redundancy Check 32-bit) is a checksum algorithm that produces a 32-bit (8 hex character) value used to detect data corruption.
a2: No. CRC32 is designed for error detection, not security. Use SHA-256 or similar for cryptographic purposes.
a3: CRC32 is used in ZIP archives, PNG images, Ethernet frames, MPEG-2 streams, and many other formats for integrity checking.
a4: Yes, files up to 100MB are supported. The calculation runs entirely in your browser.
q5: Why do I get different results for the same text?
a5: Ensure you are using the same encoding. This tool uses UTF-8 encoding for text input. Trailing spaces or newlines can also change the result.
